member.summary: The problem is that Core.Data must be STA. An STA thread can't be a threadpool thread and must pump a message loop

member.name: T:CoreHostGDB.Common.StringToBoolConverter
member.summary: If the string length > 0 is "true" then true is returned, otherwise false.
member.remarks: If the string value "true" is passed as the parameter the returned bool is flipped

member.name: M:CoreHostGDB.Common.StringToBoolConverter.Convert(System.Object,System.Type,System.Object,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Converts OnlineUri query string length to a bool. A query string length > 0 returns true
member.returns: Pass "true" as the parameter to flip (reverse) the returned bool (i.e. !true or !false)

member.name: T:CoreHostGDB.Common.BoolToVisibilityConverter
member.summary: Converts the given bool to a Visibility

member.name: T:CoreHostGDB.ForRows.DynamicDataRow
member.summary: Inherits from . Implements a class that dynamically changes its properties at runtime. The set of properties is changed to match the columns of the selected GDB table.

member.name: T:CoreHostGDB.Program
member.summary: WPF application that implements a generic File GDB reader
member.remarks: 1. Open this solution in Visual Studio 1. Click the build menu and select Build Solution. 1. Click the Start button to run the WPF app. 1. Specify a valid path to a file geodatabase path in the 'Open a GDB' input field and click the 'Open' button. 1. The 'Open a Dataset' dropdown is filled with all available datasets. 1. Select a dataset on the 'Open a Dataset' dropdown and click the 'Read' button. 1. View the table showing the dataset's content. ![UI](Screenshots/Screen.png)
